title: What are some amazing historical timeline events? - Quora

response.answer_text: Betty White is older than sliced bread.Betty white was born in 1922 while sliced bread was made in 1928 Harvard University was founded before CalculusHarvard was founded in 1636 while calculus was developed in 1684 and further developed in 1687. At the same time, Galileo was still alive during Harvard’s early years died in 1642. The last time the Chicago Cubs (until 2016) won a World Series, the Ottoman Empire still existed.Chicago Clubs won in 1908, and the Ottoman Empire’s fell in 1922. The Pyramids of Giza were built in the time of wolly mammoths.The last of wolly mammoths went extinct around 1700 b.c.e, while the pyramids were built around 2630–2611 B.C.E The fax machine was invented the same year as the Oregon trail migration.The Oregon trail took place during 1843, while Alexander Bain invented a fax machine the same year. The jewelry store Tiffany & Co. and Macy’s were founded before Italy was a country.Macy's was founded in 1858 and Tiffany & Co. was founded officially in 1853. Italy became a country in 1861 France was still using the guillotine when “Star Wars” came out.Star Wars came out a few months before the last execution by guillotine in 1977. Two of President John Tyler’s grandsons are still alive.The Eiffel Tower was completed in 1889, which is the same year Nintendo was founded and that Van Gogh painted “The Starry Night.”Cleopatra lived closer in time to the invention of Snapchat than to the construction of the Great Pyramid at Giza.Cleopatra died on 30 b.c.e, while the pyramids were built in 2630 and completed in 2611. The difference is more 2500 years. The Great Pyramid is older to the Romans than the Romans are to us.The Stegosaurus is older to the Tyrannosaurus rex than the T. rex is to us.The t-rex lived 90 to 70 million years ago became a species about 74 million years after the Stegosaurus died out. The oldest living person was born closer to the signing of the US Constitution, then today.Emma Morano-Martinuzzi, the oldest living person , who died in April at age 117, was born in 1899. That's 112 years after the signing of the Constitution, which was signed in 1787. Oxford University is older than the Aztec civilization.Oxford began teaching in some form all the way back in the year 1096. By most accounts, the Aztecs didn't begin their civilization until the beginning of the 13th century. The landing on the moon only took place 66 years after the Wright brothers invented human flight.The Ottoman Empire still existed when Paramount Studios was founded.The Ottoman Empire was founded around the year 1300, but it lasted all the way until 1922. Paramount was founded 10 years earlier in 1912. Will Smith is now older than James Avery (Uncle Phil) was when Fresh Prince of Bel-Air started.Not sure how it's even possible, but Will Smith is now 48 years old. James Avery was 45 when Fresh Prince premiered back in 1990. If they made a That '90s Show and waited the same amount of time after the decade as That '70s Show waited after the '70s, the show would be made in 2017.Anne Frank, Martin Luther King Jr., and Barbara Walters were all born in the same year.All of them were born in 1929 Some of the world's whales that are alive today were born before Moby-Dick was writtenSome bowhead whales are believed to have a lifespan of more than 200 years. Since Moby Dick was published in 1851, that means there may be whales out there who are nearly 50 years older than the book. Pluto didn't even get to complete one orbit around the sun between the time it was discovered and the time it was declassified as a planet. (It's now a dwarf planet again)Pluto was discovered as a planet in 1930. It takes about 248 years to orbit. 9/11 happened closer to the fall of the Berlin Wall than to today.The Berlin Wall fell in 1989, only 12 years before 9/11. The 16th anniversary will happen the upcoming Monday. If the history of the universe were placed on a calendar year, humans would only exist starting around 11:59 p.m. on Dec. 31 More than 6% of all humans who have ever lived are alive today.Thanks to a boom in population growth following advances in technology and medicine, the current human population living on Earth right now is about 6% of the entire human population in the entire history of the planet. 8 Surprising Historical Facts That Will Change Your Concept Of Time Forever 23 Facts That Will Totally Fuck With Your Perception Of Time

Star Wars was released in the same year as the last guillotine executionDeath by guillotine was France’s official execution method until 1981, and the last execution occurred in 1977. The Ouija Board is as ancient and mystical as MonopolyThe Ouija Board was invented by several Baltimore businessmen in 1890, and the word “Ouija” is still a Parker Brothers trademark. The first “car” was invented in 1769, seven years before the signing of the US Declaration of IndependenceThe first car was this clunky piece of crap, by the way:  The last Union Civil War widow was still alive when 50 Cent hit the top of the Forbes Richest Rapper listShe died in 2003, having married veteran John Janeway in 1927 when she was 18 and he was 81. World War Two didn’t officially end until 1990, when Russia and Germany signed the Treaty on the Final Settlement with Respect to Germany.That’s the same year my mum married my dad. Wounded Knee, the most recent clash between the US government and Native Americans, occurred in 1973.The same year as Watergate. Edit: I have noticed that a lot of you are confused by me saying that Wounded Knee happened at the same time as Watergate. On the 27th of February, 1973, approximately 200 Oglala Lakota and followers of the American Indian Movement(AIM) seized and occupied the town of Wounded Knee, South Dakota, on the Pine Ridge Indian Reservation. The protest followed the failure of an effort of the Oglala Sioux Civil Rights Organization (OSCRO) to impeach tribal president Richard Wilson, whom they accused of corruption and abuse of opponents. Additionally, protesters criticized the United States government's failure to fulfill treaties with Native American people and demanded the reopening of treaty negotiations. I think that should clear things up.
